Row.Text: The Steel Mill is an American unique building that greatly increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of a city. Unlike the Factory it replaces, the Steel Mill boosts production of armored and naval units in the city, and [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal tiles yield +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires 1 [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal.

Increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of a city. Boosts production of armored and naval units. [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal tiles yield +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Only America may built it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Requires 1 [ICON_RES_COAL] Coal.

From 1875 to 1920 American steel production grew from 380,000 tons to 60 million tons annually, making the U.S. by far the dominant world leader. A key element was the easy availability of iron ore, coal, and manpower. Iron ore of fair quality was abundant in the eastern states, but the Lake Superior region contained huge deposits of exceedingly rich ore. This iron ore was shipped through the Lakes to ports such as Chicago, Detroit, Cleveland, Erie and Buffalo for shipment by rail to the steel mills. Abundant coal was available in Pennsylvania and Ohio.
